alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 6:26PM CDT until May 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL ROGER MILLS...CUSTER...SOUTHWESTERN BLAINE AND SOUTHEASTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 625 PM CDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms were located in Custer City as well as near Stafford, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Foss Reservoir, Fay and Stafford. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
